headline: Classic Bran Muffins
description: Bran muffins made with wheat bran are a delicious source of fiber the whole family will enjoy! Buttermilk and raisins make them super moist.

video.description: These muffins are full of fiber, and are also moist and very tasty.
video.name: Classic Bran Muffins

name: Classic Bran Muffins

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners.
Mix wheat bran and buttermilk together in a large bowl; let stand for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, beat brown sugar, oil, egg, and vanilla together in a separate bowl until light and fluffy; stir into buttermilk mixture.
Sift flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together; stir into buttermilk mixture until just blended. Fold in raisins; spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 2/3 full.
Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 15 to 20 minutes. Cool in the tin briefly, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: Very good reliable recipe, so quick and easy. My favourite muffins üòäüëç
I made these and Totally forgot the sugar and they are very good. specially with a bit of jam. I will try next time with 1/3 cup sugar.
Hey here we go great muffins, and all that fiber!!!

I‚Äôve made this recipe a number of times and it always is delicious. My wife suggested to try blueberries instead of raisins. I put the blueberries in a little of the flower mixture so they would not settle and increased the baking time to 18 minutes because of the addition. Also, I put the batter in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to an hour before baking. This increases their moistness.

These are really yummy! I used powdered buttermilk and white sugar because I didn‚Äôt realize we didn‚Äôt have brown. They still baked up perfectly! Soft, moist, lovely crunchy crust on the top. I did add 2 T espresso powder and a 1/4 cup chocolate chips instead of raisins. Very yummy!
I added some applesauce and cinnamon - these were very good!
Flat as pancakes . Great taste, leavening agents current, very little stirring ‚Ä¶ but still very flat

Very good and low in calories. I cut sugar to 1/3 cup. Added 1&1/2 tsp cinnamon 1/2 tsp nutmeg. 1tsp salt. 5oz by weight grated apples. Fluffy texture. Left out the raisins and will add them next time.
I'm pretty sure this recipe used to say optional 1 tsp of cinnamon. I recommend adding this.

I used this recipe to recreate Honey Pecan Bran Muffins that I was craving but no longer living near the bakery that sells them, and it was perfect! I did not alter the recipe however I added a heaping dallop of the following mixture - 1/4 c each butter (softened), brown sugar, white sugar and 2 1/2 TBSP honey to each bottom and topped with pecans then filled each tin about 3/4 full of batter. Baking time took 15 minutes. Once out of the oven I spread the remaining butter mixture on the top of each, loosened from pan, then inverted onto the cooling rack. So delicious!
These were surprisingly moist. Used large muffin tin, sprayed with PAM baking spray. I added chopped walnuts for texture, otherwise stuck to the recipe. The Mrs loved them!

Can you figure out why my muffins have flat tops that spread? I follow the directions to a t. Second time making them. Absolutely delicious but I would like to f figure it out. Leavening agents are fresh and I do not overman.
A good reliable recipe. Definitely better with two eggs and more raisins.
Excellent! I was getting in a breakfast rut, not knowing what to make and this hit the spot!
Awesome recipe. Easy to add whatever you like. I add 1 1/2 cups of flour and 1 cup of wheat bran

The ratio of buttermilk to bran seemed low‚Ä¶I felt it needed more liquid. I added a couple tbsp of molasses and I pre soaked the raisins to plump them up. Turned out delicious! Will be a keeper for sure!
My husband is declaring these muffins to be miracle muffins because they have had a miraculous difference in his problematic digestive system. He has two each morning with coffee, happy man.
Tastes like baking soda and baking powder that's no bueno. Isn't as dark and rich as I've had. Maybe I needed to add molasses or honey or something

My kids loved these so then the next time I made them I made some changes: I used apple sauce instead of oil, I added cinnamon, I used almond milk instead of cows milk, and I used gluten free flour. I had to almost double the milk watching to be sure it was similar in wetness to the prior batch and then had to bake them longer too but they were yummy!!! Will do this again for sure.
Definitely a keeper. These muffins were fluffy and oh so tasty. Ive already made them 2 days in a row. Will be my go to bran muffin for sure. Thank you!

While good, Classic Bran Muffins aren‚Äôt exceptional. I subbed coconut oil & used only 1/2c sugar; no raisins. I suppose these are favorite sugar-not-honey bran muffins so far. 7-2022 Update: ‚ÄòNot nearly as good after Day1.
Love this with some tweaks I used chopped dates and extra large muffin tins to make just 6. Baked for the full 20 minutes and once out of the over I brushed the tops with honey butter.

I made these muffins for my dad. He loves bran muffins, which are increasingly difficult to find these days. These bran muffins are the best I‚Äôve ever tasted. I substituted dried cranberries for raisins (a personal preference, I hate raisins). Store bought bran muffins are overly sweet and generally disgusting. This recipe redeems bran muffins.

Amazing! I veganized it, swapping the egg for 1 Tbsp ground flaxseed and 3 Tbps of water, swapped the 1/3 C oil for 1/3 C of applesauce and for the buttermilk I substituted 1Tbsp of Apple cider vinegar in a 1 C measuring cup and fill the rest with almond milk or milk of your choosing. I use 2 C of crushed raisin bran. Turned out fantastic and my family loves them.

A solid base recipe and first attempt. Moist for a bran muffin. I didn't have buttermilk and used 2% lactose free milk instead. Alterations I would try in the future: maybe a dash of cinnamon or nutmeg, slightly less salt and more vanilla, maybe grate a little carrot for natural sweetness and dimension. Over all I am very pleased with this classic recipe. Will make again :)

These are the Best bran muffins! I used Bran flakes and added about 2 tablespoons more brown sugar. I also sprinkled a few quick oats on the top just for looks. Also used golden and brown raisins. Everybody loves them.‚ù§Ô∏è YUM!!!üòã

I'd give it six stars if I could. I didn‚Äôt have buttermilk and used sour cream instead. Didn‚Äôt hurt it at all, so it‚Äôs good to know you can substitute and still get decent results. Best bran muffin I've ever had! Going to make them again as they didn‚Äôt last the day.
My husband and I love these. The only change I made , I used apple sauce instead of the oil‚Ä¶ oil can bring on heartburn for my hubby. Turned out great!!
Great bran muffins. I admit to two tweaks. I added 1 2/3 Saskatoon berries substituting for raisins .I also brushed a tiny amount of melted honey to the tops just as they came out of the oven. A hit.
Substitute honey for brown sugar. Used olive oil. Used 1 cup of rehydrated raisin
Absolutely fantastic taste. I added a bit more buttermilk, no raisins and a teensy more brown sugar. Wonderful crumb, texture and taste. Delicious with coffee. Will make again and again.
Make double the recipe. Substitute applesauce for oil. Double the raisins. Halve the sugar. Use only whole wheat flour. Add 1/2 c. molasses for the doubled recipe.
Excellent recipe‚Ä¶ easy Peezy. They should fit in well with my new diet.

I'm making this recipe this morning and will update my rating when they are done. Can I make a loaf instead of muffins? I baked this for 45 minutes at 350 after preheating the over to 375. I appears to have turned out very nice. Tastes excellent! I added some molasses in place of a bit of the brown sugar and increased the vanilla to 1 tsp based on other reviews.
I added a little more brown sugar and some cinnamon and nutmeg. I also doubled the recipe to get larger muffins.

Great recipe! I had no eggs, so I subbed 1/4 cup of applesauce instead of the egg, and it worked great. I also did half whole wheat flour, half all-purpose. I made a double batch (to use up the butter milk and apple sauce in my fridge) and ended up making 12 muffins as well as a loaf! Totally DELISH!

These were very simple and fun to make. Add cinnamon and nutmeg and 1/3 cup of honey as well as the brown sugar. Today I added a ripe banana and 1/3 cup more flour. Very moist and delicious. The entire family‚Äôs been devouring them. I also use regular 2% milk.

After looking in grocery stores to find ready made muffins to no avail, I found this recipe! This will be my go to whenever I have the craving for bran muffins. The only thing I changed was using coconut oil for vegetable oil and it gave these muffins a light hint of coconut. 10 stars!!
incredible easy and good

Outstanding, very light. My additions were chopped prunes, chopped pecans, a mashed banana and sprinkle of granola cereal on top. My substitutions were apple sauce for the oil, Splenda brown sugar instead of regular and all purpose flour cuz I didn‚Äôt have whole wheat. Maybe I‚Äôll try almond flour next time. They were SOOOO GOOD!

Endlessly adaptable!! This recipe takes to any substitution you can imagine. I've subbed sour cream or yogurt for the buttermllk, applesauce for the canola oil, cut the sugar to 1/3 c., used honey instead of sugar, used part wheat flour for the all-purpose flour, used frozen berries or a couple of bananas instead of raisins...it always turns out beautifully. I prefer oat bran to wheat bran.
I added sour cream

This recipe was really good! Not too sweet, but just sweet enough. It was crumbly because of the bran, but that's to be expected. We substituted Craisins for the raisins and they were delicious. Thanks for the recipe!
Very good. My batter seemed a little thick and they are a tiny bit crumbly but they are still warm. Taste is great.

I don't understand the review stating has had no flavor. I made it exactly as is and it came out very moist and flavorful. I had family over and everybody loved it. I do plan on trying one of the substitutions of apple sauce for the oil, but that's more out of curiosity than I think that it needs to change.
Great bones. Added a little allspice and cinnamon crumb on top.
They were delicious and moist. My husband loved them! Substituted buttermilk for milk with a squirt of lemon juice.

This is such a GOOD recipe. I didn't change a thing. I've made them twice. They're moist and delicious and this is one of only a few recipes that actually give the amount of pieces given. My whole family loves them!

This is a wonderful recipe. However, bran flour is hard to get in my area. I was lucky enough to find out that the Mennonite store that I frequent for fresh eggs, etc. would grind some up for me. It must be kept in the refrigerator or freezer. I share them with a couple of neighbors and they love them. They are easy to make and I love them warm with butter for breakfast.
My new favorite bran muffin recipe. I cut the sugar to 1/2 c. and use some whole wheat flour, but otherwise I follow the recipe. Easy and delicious!
Love them easy to make

Made these yesterday and they were really good! I only used half a cup of brown sugar and a quarter cup of oil but they still turned out great. Added some currants (don't like big, sweet raisins) and some pecan pieces. Yummy! Will definitely make these again!
Love this recipe! I always add raisins and sometimes nuts!

I just made these for the first time. I used 1/2 cup crushed bran flakes and 1 cup All Bran. I subbed dates for raisins and used 1 cup. I sprinkled some vanilla sugar over the dates to prevent them from clumping and sinking. I baked them 20 minutes; 15 not enough. Result very good but a bit too sweet. Next time will reduce brown sugar to 1/3 cup.

I love it. I have been making it for 3 years‚Ä¶at least twice a month for my husband and myself. I add chia and flax seeds, use bran cereal in place of bran flour , use 1/2 whole wheat and 1/2 white flour, and sometimes add oatmeal or granola to the mix. Wonderful every time
These are very tasty muffins and especially good with butter and cinnamon peach butter. Our daughter is unable to taste anything but she enjoyed the texture. I will be making them again.
I make these with bran flakes cereal rather than wheat bran, but that's all I change. My family loves them with and without raisins.

Didn't know what wheat bran was, so I just used All Bran cereal. After reading other reviews, I tried adding a sprinkle of cinnamon, used unsweetened applesauce instead of the oil and used 1/2 molasses and 1/2 brown sugar. I made a double batch, and realized after baking them that I didn't double the molasses and brown sugar, but I liked them the way they came out! They were moist, flavorful and the raisins gave them plenty of sweetness. They don't rise very much so you dont need to worry about them overflowing the pans. Mine were done in 15 min. Easy to make and easy to clean up!

We love this recipe! I did make a few minor additions based on our preferences. 
I increased the raisins to 3/4 c. And added spices‚Ä¶.1 tsp.of cinnamon, 1/2 tsp. of ground Nutmeg, and 1/4 tsp. of ground cloves.
Just an FYI‚Ä¶I used the Aldi brand Bran Cereal, also, had to substitute a tsp. Of lemon juice in no sugar Almond milk for the buttermilk and used the Splenda brown sugar blend, and they still turned out moist and delicious.
I cut the oil to 1/4 c and add 1/3 c applesauce with golden raisins - Outstanding!

This recipe turned out some delicious muffins! Everything I had hoped they would be. I added pecans as well as raisins and they are magical. Thank you!

Instead of buttermilk, I took 1 cup of milk and added 1 tablespoon of vinegar (lemon juice works too), gave it a stir and let it sit for 10 minutes. This had the same results and meant I didn‚Äôt have to buy buttermilk.
I triple the ingredients, only used baking powder without adding baking soda and put less sugar. They came out perfectly nice

Really good basic bran muffin recipe.
I cut back on the sugar just a tiny bit and added orange zest and a small amount of orange juice to the batter. This gave them a little something extra and was an easy, delicious addition if you like that taste!

Loved it! Changes:
K√©fir for Buttermilk (cuz I had it)
1/4 c applesauce for Oil
egg white only (cuz I had it)
2/3 fancy molasses plus 1 Tbsp for Brown Sugar
50-50 whole wheat and white flour
plumped my golden raisins

The recipe was very moist and not too sweet, perfect with butter .

I love these for 2 reasons : versatile and full of fiber which is good for you! I followed the recipe to the ingredient except I have mixed white flour to half whole wheat one and they turn out delicious! 
I also always triple the recipe because these muffins freeze well! 
I also mixed half cranberries and half golden raisins for extra kick. 
Next time I might mix half append a and half brown sugar to make them great for diabetics! 
This recipe is a keeper!!!

Love this recipe. I swapped applesauce for the oil and used plain yogurt for the buttermilk. I used All Bran buds cereal - it‚Äôs the worst cereal ever, but makes really good muffins. This is a great recipe, very forgiving and swappable ingredients. Enjoy.

Amazing!!! Made these last night to have for breakfast this morning and only half made it to the morning. My husband and son LOVED them! I followed the recipe, except for 2 steps which were suggested by one reviewer - instead of buttermilk, I used 1 TBSP of lemon juice and milk to make 1 cup of milk. Also, instead of 2/3 cup of brown sugar, I used 1/3 cup of brown sugar and 1/3 cup of molasses. I will definitely be making these ones again!!!!
Made to recipe, omitted raisins great muffin. Wife loves them

I made it as written the first time and give it maybe 4 stars. The second time I subbed a 3.9 oz. apple sauce pack for the oil and a heaping 1/2 cup of blueberries for the raisins. 
I'll be doing the apple sauce and blueberries from now on. 
I also aim for 11 slightly bigger muffins.

16 min. @ 375 gave my Thermopop internal readings of 200*-205* for a perfect finish.

Great muffins! Here are a few tips for bakery style tall domed muffins. I ended up using more milk because the bran was completely dry after mixing in the buttermilk, I probably added about 1/2 cup more milk and let it soak as instructed. I upped the vanilla to one teaspoon. And folded in dried cranberries, do not over-mix! Muffins are meant to be mixed until all the flour is JUST incorporated. I preheated the oven to 425F baked them on the middle rack for 10 minutes, dropped the temperature to 375F for an additional 7 minutes and checked with a toothpick and they were done! Time will vary on your oven but in general always start the temp at 425F for proper oven spring and high dome muffins. Happy baking!
This is such a great recipe. I used Oatmilk and lemon juice to create the buttermilk and used whole wheat flour instead of all purpose flour. I‚Äôll definitely be making this recipe again.
It was very good! I made it with raisins.
Wife likes these and that‚Äôs saying something!
I make this weekly. I use 1/2 cup whole wheat flour, 1/2 cup almond flour. I use 1 tbls sugar and 2 teaspoons coconut oil.

These are amazing! I tweak the recipe a little for health reasons. I buy wheat bran from Hodgson Mills (that was the hardest to item to find!) but there's is great! I like my most recent batch, I used pure pumpkin in place of the oil but I did 2/3 cup (on accident), but they turned out so delicious! I chop up some prunes instead of raisins, I add at least a cup of walnuts, I add whole flax seed and wheat bran, plus pumpkin pie spice and lots of cinnamon. I know this might seem like a lot of changes, but it's not because the original recipe is not already amazing! It just suites my needs and I'm so grateful because I never would have come up with the perfect muffin for me without it!! Thank you Janet!
Absolutely the best, taste so yummy and very healthy for you.
Awesome
I made them and truly enjoyed them. Added apples . This will be my bran muffins recipe to go to. I will try some of the suggestions.
Tasteless muffins. Need to have molasses to make the flavourful. Would not make again
They were delicious, I added 1/3 c of maple syrup to they would be a but more moist and they were. Excellent choice

These were delicious. I changed the recipe quite a bit because I needed to use up some sourdough discard and I have a whole food plant based diet. Like many others, I subbed applesauce for the oil. I made a "sour milk" with soy milk and vinegar. I used dates and bananas to sweeten and added pecans.

I always seek All Recipes to follow. their ingredients are usually available and their directions are clear and the results are dependable
They look just like pictured. Didn't have buttermilk so added vinegar to whole milk snf turned out perfect. In addition to raisins I added walnuts.
Happy result

I was looking for a bran muffin recipe since you cannot find a boxed version in the store. I made the recipe as it is written and it came out WONDERFUL. Other than substituting some different dried fruits, I don't see myself making any changes in the future.
29 years as a baker. This is my go to recipe. I add some molasses with the wet ingredients . Also sprinkle some turbinado sugar on top before baking.

Absolutely Fantastic 
I‚Äôve been looking for a great Bran Muffin and I found it. 
I altered it by using whole wheat flour instead of white and I added 1/4 c of molasses. Other than that I followed the recipe exactly. Family luv them.
The only thing that I changed was the amount of sugar 1/2 cup instead of 2/3

These were very easy to make and came out perfect. I subbed 1/3 cup honey for the brown sugar and added a little extra love(cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves). These are good plain, with a little butter, or a little cream cheese frosting, or even a little sugar free jam. Excellent breakfast option. Will make again

Very, very good. I used half of the sugar, and added molasses to complete the measurement. My mixture wasn‚Äôt as wet as the mixture in the video, but they didn‚Äôt go flat on top. They had a fluffy rise when baked. I will definitely be putting this recipe in the regular rotation.

These were moist and delicious! I made some changes based on the reviews and what I had in the house. I used oat bran (all I had), half brown sugar and half molasses, and added a ripe banana and some cinnamon. Yum.
It is easy to make. I love bran muffins, but I don't care for raisins. This is the best recipe by far. I have made these numerous times.
I used oat bran instead of wheat bran. I used golden brown sugar. The muffins are light and very tasty. I made buttermilk with 1 T white vinegar with 2% milk to make 1 cup. Sooooo good!

A delicious, healthy option when you want something sweet. I made the original recipe, and I have made the recipe using no added sugar applesauce. Both recipes taste delicious so I will be making it with the applesauce to save calories. When using applesauce, give the muffin liners a quick spray of cooking spray so they don‚Äôt stick, as one reviewer suggested.
Fantastic muffin. I substituted unsweetened applesauce for the oil and only used 1/2 cup of brown sugar. Will make again!
these muffins are incredible. easy and quick.i make these a couple times a month
This recipe has quickly become a weekly bake for the family. I have increased the raisins (+1/2 cup) to everyone's pleasure. Very easy to prepare.
Quick and easy and freeze well too!

I make these about once a week. I add dried blueberries and raisins, essentially doubling the amount, and top each one off with 3 frozen blueberries (fresh are hard to come by here) 

I use coconut oil which definitely improves the taste. I can't get wheat bran here, so I run "all bran" through the food processor and use that. 

They freeze well, but fresh cannot be beat.
OMG These muffins are the best. I added two times the raisins and sprinkled raw sugar on the top. WOW This will be my go to recipe for bran muffins from now on.
Very good muffin. Less dense than other recipes I have tried.
